summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The DMO_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS enumeration defines flags that describe an output stream.

member.name: _DMO_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS.DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_WHOLE_SAMPLES
member.summary: The stream contains whole samples. Samples do not span multiple buffers, and buffers do not contain partial samples.

member.name: _DMO_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS.DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_SINGLE_SAMPLE_PER_BUFFER
member.summary: Each buffer contains exactly one sample.

member.name: _DMO_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS.DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_FIXED_SAMPLE_SIZE
member.summary: All the samples in this stream are the same size.

member.name: _DMO_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS.DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_DISCARDABLE
member.summary: The stream is discardable. Within calls to , the DMO can discard data for this stream without copying it to an output buffer.

member.name: _DMO_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS.DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_OPTIONAL
member.summary: The stream is optional. An optional stream is discardable. Also, the application can ignore this stream entirely; it does not have to set the media type for the stream. Optional streams generally contain additional information, or data not needed by all applications.
